entries.title: Tennis legend Martina Navratilova diagnosed with throat and breast cancer
entries.description: The 66-year-old Czechoslovakia-born naturalized American said Monday that her prognosis was good and that she will start treatment this month.

entries.title: Burkina Faso's military regime expels French ambassador
entries.description: The military junta has expelled French diplomat Luc Hallade, authorities said Monday. Anti-French sentiment has been growing in the former French colony since the new junta leader, Capt. Ibrahim Traore, seized power in September.

entries.title: Big Tech colonizes seabed to assert control of the internet
entries.description: Through an undersea fiber optic cables network, Google, Facebook, Amazon and Microsoft control internet access, turning upside down a model originating the invention of the telegraph.

entries.title: France's César film awards bans anyone accused of sexual violence
entries.description: The announcement followed concern over recent allegations of rape emerged against a potential candidate for the 2023 awards, Sofiane Bennacer.

entries.title: France takes the plunge on subsea cable security
entries.description: A leader in the seabed cabling ecosystem, France has tightened its subsea cable security, a highly strategic industry for global communications.

entries.title: Disposable cartons for French fast-food restaurants are (almost) gone
entries.description: Since January 1, disposable tableware has been banned in French fast food restaurants for meals eaten on site. Designed to prevent approximately 150,000 tons of waste per year, the measure faces several obstacles

entries.title: Ukraine claims responsibility for deadly strike on Russian troops in Donetsk region
entries.description: The strike delivered a new setback for Russia which in recent months has reeled from a Ukrainian counteroffensive.

entries.title: Charity rescue ship races to save migrants despite Italy's new law
entries.description: The Doctors Without Borders ship was en route to a southern Italian port with 85 rescued people when it received a call from other migrants in distress.

entries.title: Brazil lines up to pay its final respects to Pelé
entries.description: People traveled to say goodbye to The King before his funeral procession on Tuesday.

entries.title: In French parliament, the right looks to overcome its divisions and the far right its isolation
entries.description: For the new year, the conservative Les Républicains are determined to show that it is not just the government's deputy. Meanwhile, the far-right Rassemblement National has been unable to form alliances in the Assemblée Nationale.

entries.title: French interior minister promises 'spectacular actions' in visit to overseas Mayotte
entries.description: Visiting the island after a wave of violence in November, Gérald Darmanin said that migration and security were not the only issues affecting the department.

entries.title: 'Qatargate': EU parliament chief moves to lift two MEPs' immunity amid corruption scandal
entries.description: Half a dozen political figures have already been arrested in the scandal involving Qatar, including the Greek MEP Eva Kaili, who had been vice president of the European Parliament.

entries.title: Macron plays the 'work' card for 2023
entries.description: While the government prepares for its controversial pension reform, the French president spent his New Year address calling on the French to 'work more' to 'transform' France.

entries.title: French left-wing parties faced with unity challenge as pension reform looms
entries.description: Obstacles are piling up against the building of a united front against the long-awaited reform sought by French President Emmanuel Macron.

entries.title: Iranian human rights activist denounces sexual abuse in prisons
entries.description: 50-year-old Narges Mohammadi, who is serving a lengthy sentence in Tehran's notorious Evin prison, had the courage to describe the treatment of women arrested during anti-regime protests.

entries.title: Pelé's final return to Santos, the city where he built his legend
entries.description: Edson Arantes do Nascimento will be buried on Tuesday in the southern Brazilian city that is in mourning for its 'king.'

entries.title: Actor Jeremy Renner in 'critical but stable' condition after snow plow accident
entries.description: Representatives said that the Bourne Legacy star was receiving 'excellent care' in hospital after suffering serious injuries plowing snow.

entries.title: Thousands turn up to see Benedict XVI lying in state at Vatican
entries.description: The faithful were expected to pay their respects to the former pope, who died on Saturday, December 31, ahead of his funeral later this week.

entries.title: Lula sworn in as reconciliatory president, rising from ashes of Brazilian politics
entries.description: No incident disrupted Lula's swearing-in ceremony, which was held in the absence of Jair Bolsonaro.

entries.title: 2022, a fitful year for commodity and energy prices
entries.description: Russia's invasion of Ukraine caused upheaval and fears of shortages in the energy and commodities sectors. Experts warn shocks

entries.title: Anita Pointer of the Pointer sisters dies at 74
entries.description: She and the three other members of the R&B group became world-famous with hits including 'I'm So Excited'.

entries.title: Floods in Philippines leave 51 dead
entries.description: Some 19 were still missing following massive floods that devastated parts of the country over the Christmas weekend.

entries.title: Venezuela's Maduro says willing to work at normalizing US ties
entries.description: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro broke off relations with Washington in 2019, when the administration of then-president Donald Trump recognized Juan Guaido as Venezuela's 'interim president.'

entries.title: Joey le Soldat : 'Young people believe that nothing can prevent the fracture with France'
entries.description: 'From Dakar to Djibouti, a tour of the Africa-France relationship' (3/11). The rapper from Burkina Faso does not mince his words when explaining the disenchantment expressed by the new generation toward the former colonial power.

entries.title: The French Senate, the government's centerpiece in the parliamentary game
entries.description: To get around a fragile balance in the Assemblée Nationale, the government is increasingly starting the examination of its bills in the Senate.

entries.title: From zero-Covid to rapidly removing restrictions: Three years of disruptive health management in China
entries.description: The country had to abruptly abandon a health policy that had become financially and socially untenable.

entries.title: In the Mojave Desert, the rebirth of the only American rare earth mine
entries.description: With support from the US government, mine operator MP Materials is reviving the Mountain Pass site. The company is taking advantage of the global appetite for magnets for electric motors and wind turbines.

entries.title: Biosourced and biodegradable fishing nets could help avoid a 'biodiversity catastrophe'
entries.description: Tested in real conditions by fishermen, these prototypes reduce plastic waste at sea and are compostable when brought back to land.

entries.title: In Montpellier's Fabre Museum, Djamel Tatah explores the abstraction of his time
entries.description: Some 40 paintings featuring anonymous male and female figures give visitors a chance to grasp the artist's singular language.

entries.title: Dry January: 'Taking a break from alcohol consumption helps participants gain health capital'
entries.description: As 'Dry January' begins, Mickael Naassila, a specialist in substance abuse insists on the benefits of a reduction – even if it's temporary – in the consumption of alcohol, which is harmful from the first glass.

entries.title: Israeli missile strikes put Damascus airport out of service
entries.description: An opposition war monitor reported on Monday that the Israeli strikes hit the airport as well as an arms depot close to the facility south of Damascus. The Britain-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said four people were killed in the strike.
